If the pickup truck is in the right lane (assuming the image is from the driver's perspective), and the total width of the right lane is 3.5 meters or 3 meters, depending on the country, then the distance from the center line to the edge of the road would be 1.5 meters or 1 meter, respectively.

Since the truck seems to be in the right lane of a highway, as indicated by the white line, which might be a median or center line separating the lanes, the distance to the edge of the road would depend on whether the right lane is one side or part of a multiple-lane road.

Given the limited information, and to choose among the given options, I'll make an educated guess. Or, considering that from the center line to the edge is 1 meter, placing the truck 1 meter from the center line means it would be 2 meters from the edge—farther than 5.5 meters.
